title: Apple Announces 'M5' Chip for New MacBook Pro Line
description: Apple (AAPL) unveiled its new M5 chip, promising a 30% performance boost in CPU and graphics tasks, with new MacBook Pro models shipping next month.

title: Google AI Search Update Faces Backlash Over Misinformation
description: Google's (GOOGL) latest AI-powered search update is under scrutiny after several high-profile examples of it surfacing incorrect or bizarre information.

title: US Inflation Report Comes in Hotter Than Expected, Markets Dip
description: The latest CPI report showed a 0.5% month-over-month increase, surprising economists and sending S&P 500 futures (SPY) down 1.2% in premarket trading.

title: Netflix Stock Jumps 8% on Strong Subscriber Growth in Asia
description: Netflix (NFLX) beat earnings expectations, driven by a surge in new subscribers in its Asia-Pacific (APAC) market, easing concerns over domestic market saturation.

title: Bitcoin ETF Sees Record Outflows Amid Regulatory Jitters
description: Spot Bitcoin ETFs (BTCUSD) experienced their largest single-day outflow, as investors grow nervous about upcoming SEC stablecoin regulations.

title: Meta's Horizon Worlds Hits 5 Million Active Users, Stock Climbs
description: Meta (META) announced its flagship metaverse platform, Horizon Worlds, has surpassed 5 million monthly active users, boosting investor confidence in its long-term bet.

title: Tesla Lowers Model 3 Price in Europe to Combat Rising Competition
description: Tesla (TSLA) cut the price of its Model 3 in Germany and France by 5% as it faces increased pressure from European and Chinese EV manufacturers.

title: Intel Secures $10B Government Contract for New US Chip Fab
description: Intel (INTC) has been awarded a $10 billion contract under the CHIPS Act to construct a new state-of-the-art semiconductor fabrication plant in Ohio.

title: Adobe Integrates Generative Video into Premiere Pro
description: Adobe (ADBE) launched a new feature set for Premiere Pro, allowing editors to generate and modify video clips using text prompts, powered by its Firefly AI model.

title: Amazon Labor Union Files for New Election at Kentucky Warehouse
description: The Amazon Labor Union (ALU) has filed for a new union election at Amazon's (AMZN) KCVG air hub in Kentucky, opening a new front in its organizing efforts.

title: NVIDIA Faces New EU Probe Over AI Chip Market Dominance
description: Regulators in the European Union have opened a formal investigation into NVIDIA (NVDA) over concerns its dominance in the AI chip market stifles competition.

title: Salesforce Stock Slips as Analyst Downgrades to 'Neutral'
description: Salesforce (CRM) shares fell 3% after a Morgan Stanley analyst downgraded the stock from 'Buy' to 'Neutral', citing slowing growth in its core cloud products.

title: Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin Proposes New Staking Model
description: Vitalik Buterin published a new paper outlining a 'decentralized staking' model for Ethereum (ETHUSD) aimed at reducing the dominance of large staking pools.

title: PayPal Expands Crypto Services to Three New Countries
description: PayPal (PYPL) announced it is rolling out the ability to buy, hold, and sell cryptocurrencies to users in Spain, Italy, and Portugal.

title: AMD Stock Upgraded to 'Strong Buy' on AI Server Momentum
description: An analyst at Bank of America upgraded AMD (AMD) to 'Strong Buy', citing strong pre-orders for its upcoming MI400-series AI accelerators.

title: Google Delays Phasing Out Third-Party Cookies Again
description: Google (GOOGL) announced another delay to its plan to phase out third-party cookies in Chrome, pushing the timeline to late 2026 amid regulatory pressure.

title: Microsoft Partners with Japanese Government on Sovereign AI Cloud
description: Microsoft (MSFT) will build a dedicated, in-country cloud infrastructure for the Japanese government to securely run sensitive AI workloads.

title: US Weekly Jobless Claims Rise Unexpectedly
description: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits rose to 230,000 last week, higher than the 215,000 forecast, signaling a cooling labor market.

title: Oracle Q2 Earnings Miss Estimates, Cloud Growth Slows
description: Oracle (ORCL) shares tumbled 9% in extended trading after reporting fiscal Q2 earnings that missed analyst expectations, citing a slowdown in its cloud infrastructure (OCI) growth.

title: Tesla Cybertruck Deliveries Halted Over Windshield Wiper Issue
description: Tesla (TSLA) has reportedly paused deliveries of its Cybertruck to address a newly discovered flaw with its massive windshield wiper motor.

title: Apple Vision Pro 2 Rumored to be Lighter, Cheaper
description: A new report from a reliable supply chain analyst claims Apple (AAPL) is targeting a 20% weight reduction and a sub-$2,500 price point for its second-generation Vision Pro.

title: US Senator Introduces Bill to Ban Self-Custody Crypto Wallets
description: A new bill proposed in the US Senate aims to ban self-custody digital wallets, citing concerns over money laundering and national security. Bitcoin (BTCUSD) dropped 5% on the news.

title: Amazon's AWS Announces New 'Titan 2' AI Chip
description: Amazon (AMZN) unveiled its next-generation custom AI chip, 'Titan 2', designed to train large language models more efficiently than its predecessor.

title: Cisco Systems to Acquire Cybersecurity Firm for $2.5B
description: Cisco (CSCO) announced its intent to acquire cloud security firm 'CyberShield' for $2.5 billion, bolstering its Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) offerings.

title: Netflix Signs Exclusive Deal with Major Sports League
description: Netflix (NFLX) has secured its first major live sports package, signing an exclusive 5-year deal to stream NBA Tuesday night games, sources tell CNBC.

title: Google Considers Charging for AI-Powered Search Features
description: A report from Bloomberg suggests Google (GOOGL) is actively exploring plans to put its most advanced generative AI search features behind a subscription paywall.

title: Fed Chair Powell Signals Rates Will Stay 'Higher for Longer'
description: In a speech, Fed Chair Jerome Powell dashed hopes for an imminent rate cut, stating that the committee needs to see more definitive proof of cooling inflation. Markets (SPY) reacted negatively.

title: Meta to Disband its Responsible AI (RAI) Team
description: Meta (META) is dissolving its central Responsible AI team, opting to embed ethics researchers directly into its product teams, a move that has drawn criticism.

title: Solana Network Suffers Major Outage, Price Plummets 15%
description: The Solana (SOLUSD) blockchain is currently halted, with engineers investigating a network-wide consensus failure. The price of SOL has fallen sharply in response.

title: Fisker Files for Bankruptcy, Tesla Stock Rises on Reduced Competition
description: EV startup Fisker (FSRN) has officially filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. Shares of rival Tesla (TSLA) rose 2% on the news.

title: Intel's New 'Lunar Lake' Chips Show Promise in Early Benchmarks
description: Early, unverified benchmarks for Intel's (INTC) upcoming 'Lunar Lake' mobile processors show significant gains in power efficiency and AI performance over competitors.

title: Microsoft's GitHub Co-pilot Accused of Widespread License Violation
description: A new class-action lawsuit alleges that GitHub Co-pilot (MSFT) launders open-source code, violating a wide range of software licenses.

title: NVIDIA Partners with Broadcom on Next-Gen AI Infrastructure
description: NVIDIA (NVDA) and Broadcom (AVGO) announced a strategic partnership to co-develop new networking hardware optimized for massive-scale AI clusters.

title: PayPal User Growth Stagnates, Stock Dips 4%
description: PayPal (PYPL) reported flat quarter-over-quarter user growth in its Q3 earnings, causing a 4% dip in its stock as investors worry about competition from Apple Pay.

title: AMD Unveils New Ryzen 9000 Desktop Processors
description: AMD (AMD) kicked off its keynote by announcing the new Ryzen 9000 series desktop CPUs, built on its next-gen 'Zen 5' architecture, promising 'unmatched' gaming performance.

title: Amazon to Invest $5B in UK Warehouse Automation
description: Amazon (AMZN) announced a 5-year, £5 billion investment to deploy advanced robotics and automation across its UK fulfillment centers.

title: Apple Wins Appeal in App Store Antitrust Case
description: A federal appeals court has overturned a key ruling in an antitrust case against Apple (AAPL), affirming its right to control payments within its App Store.

title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink: 'Tokenization is the Next Generation for Markets'
description: In an interview, BlackRock (BLK) CEO Larry Fink reiterated his bullish stance on digital assets, calling the tokenization of real-world assets a major financial evolution.

title: Google to Shut Down 'Google Podcasts' App
description: Google (GOOGL) announced it is sunsetting its standalone 'Google Podcasts' app, migrating users and features over to YouTube Music.

title: US Manufacturing PMI Shows Unexpected Contraction
description: The S&P Global Manufacturing PMI for October fell to 49.5, below the 50.0 threshold, indicating a contraction in the sector and raising recession fears.

title: Meta's AI Image Generator Under Fire for Political Bias
description: Researchers claim Meta's (META) new generative AI tool shows significant political bias, creating stereotypical or negative images based on certain prompts.

title: Tesla Secures Lithium Supply Deal with Australian Miner
description: Tesla (TSLA) has signed a 5-year agreement with Australian miner Pilbara Minerals (PLS) to secure a long-term supply of spodumene concentrate for its battery production.

title: SEC Delays Decision on Grayscale Ethereum Trust Conversion
description: The SEC has once again postponed its decision on Grayscale's application to convert its Ethereum Trust (ETHE) into a spot ETF, pushing the deadline to January 2026.

title: Netflix Raises Prices for Standard and Premium Plans
description: Netflix (NFLX) is increasing the price of its Standard plan by $2 and its Premium plan by $3 per month in the US, its second price hike in 18 months.

title: Microsoft's Activision Blizzard Deal Clears Final Hurdle in UK
description: The UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has given final, unconditional approval for Microsoft's (MSFT) acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Earnings Preview: AI Demand in Focus
description: All eyes are on NVIDIA's (NVDA) Q3 earnings report tomorrow, with Wall Street expecting another record-breaking quarter driven by H100 GPU sales.

title: Adobe Shares Fall as DOJ Reportedly Prepares Antitrust Suit
description: Adobe (ADBE) stock dropped 6% following a report that the Department of Justice is preparing to file an antitrust lawsuit to block its $20B acquisition of Figma.

title: Google's Waymo Self-Driving Taxis Launch in Atlanta
description: Alphabet's (GOOGL) self-driving unit, Waymo, has officially launched its fully autonomous ride-hailing service to the public in Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger: 'The AI PC Is the Next Big Thing'
description: In an interview, Intel (INTC) CEO Pat Gelsinger claimed that PCs with built-in neural processing units (NPUs) will represent the most significant PC market shift in decades.

title: Consumer Confidence Index Tumbles to 9-Month Low
description: The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index fell sharply in October, as persistent inflation and high interest rates weigh on household sentiment.

title: Apple Scaling Back EV Project 'Titan', Report Says
description: Sources claim Apple (AAPL) is significantly scaling back its ambitious self-driving electric car project, now targeting a later 2030 release with less advanced features.

title: Amazon Announces 'Prime Health' Subscription Service
description: Amazon (AMZN) is bundling its pharmacy (RxPass), One Medical, and new virtual health services into a single 'Prime Health' subscription for $19.99/month.

title: Hackers Steal $80M from DeFi Protocol 'FinanceFlow'
description: The decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocol 'FinanceFlow' has been exploited, with attackers draining approximately $80 million in various crypto assets.

title: Cisco Stock Downgraded at JPMorgan on Networking Slowdown
description: JPMorgan downgraded Cisco (CSCO) from 'Overweight' to 'Neutral', warning of a cyclical slowdown in enterprise networking spend as companies digest prior purchases.

title: AMD and Intel Battle for AI PC Market Share at CES 2026
description: Both AMD (AMD) and Intel (INTC) are expected to showcase their next-generation mobile processors with advanced AI capabilities at the upcoming CES trade show.

title: NHTSA Opens Investigation into Tesla Autopilot Crashes
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) has opened a new formal investigation into Tesla's (TSLA) Autopilot system after a series of recent crashes.

title: Google's DeepMind Unveils 'Gemini 2.0' AI Model
description: Google's (GOOGL) DeepMind division has unveiled Gemini 2.0, its new flagship AI model, claiming it outperforms OpenAI's GPT-4o on several key benchmarks.

title: Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Rises as Fed Rate Hike Fears Ease
description: The S&P 500 (SPY) climbed 0.8% as weaker-than-expected jobs data eased investor fears that the Federal Reserve would pursue another interest rate hike.

title: Meta to Allow Third-Party App Stores on Quest VR Headsets
description: In a major strategy shift, Meta (META) announced it will open up its Quest platform, allowing users to install third-party app stores and sideload applications.

title: Netflix's Ad-Supported Tier Reaches 50 Million Users
description: Netflix (NFLX) revealed its ad-supported subscription tier has grown to 50 million monthly active users, marking a major milestone for its advertising business.

title: NVIDIA Q3 Earnings: A Massive Beat, Stock Soars 10%
description: NVIDIA (NVDA) reported Q3 revenue and EPS that shattered analyst expectations, with data center revenue up 350% year-over-year. The stock surged 10% in after-hours trading.

title: Microsoft Azure Announces New Generative AI Tools for Developers
description: At its Ignite conference, Microsoft (MSFT) launched a new suite of generative AI tools for Azure, designed to help developers build and deploy AI agents.

title: US Treasury Sanctions Crypto Mixer 'Tornado Cash' Again
description: The U.S. Treasury Department has issued new sanctions against cryptocurrency mixer Tornado Cash, citing its use by North Korean hacking groups.

title: Oracle and Palantir (PLTR) Announce AI Cloud Partnership
description: Oracle (ORCL) and Palantir (PLTR) announced a partnership to make Palantir's AI platforms available on Oracle's Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).

title: Apple Faces $2B Fine in EU Music Streaming Antitrust Case
description: The European Commission is reportedly set to fine Apple (AAPL) €2 billion for anticompetitive practices related to its music streaming rules in the App Store.

title: Google Photos Gets New AI-Powered 'Magic Editor' Features
description: Google (GOOGL) is rolling out an update to Google Photos that adds more advanced AI editing features, including 'Magic Eraser' for video and 'Style Transfer'.

title: Amazon's Project Kuiper Launches First Two Prototype Satellites
description: Amazon's (AMZN) satellite internet initiative, Project Kuiper, successfully launched and established contact with its first two prototype satellites, KuiperSat-1 and KuiperSat-2.

title: BYD Overtakes Tesla as World's Top-Selling EV Maker
description: Chinese automaker BYD sold more electric vehicles than Tesla (TSLA) in the third quarter, making it the new global leader in EV sales.

title: Fidelity Files for Spot Ethereum ETF with SEC
description: Asset management giant Fidelity has joined the race for a spot Ethereum (ETHUSD) ETF, submitting its 19b-4 filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Retail Sales Data Misses Expectations, Showing Consumer Strain
description: October retail sales rose only 0.1% month-over-month, far below the 0.4% expected, indicating that US consumer spending is weakening.

title: Microsoft to Invest $3B in German AI Data Centers
description: Microsoft (MSFT) announced a €3 billion investment over the next two years to build new AI and cloud data centers in Germany.

title: AMD Stock Dips as PC Market Outlook Softens
description: AMD (AMD) shares fell 5% after its Q3 report, as a weak forecast for the personal computing market overshadowed strong data center sales.

title: Netflix to Open Physical 'Netflix House' Retail Locations
description: Netflix (NFLX) is launching permanent, experiential retail locations called 'Netflix House' that will feature themed restaurants, merchandise, and interactive exhibits.

title: Intel's Foundry Services Lands 'Major US Customer'
description: Intel (INTC) announced its foundry business has signed a significant deal with an unnamed 'major US customer' to use its 18A process technology.

title: Adobe Adds AI-Powered Music Generation to Audition
description: Adobe (ADBE) is integrating new generative AI features into its Audition software, allowing users to create royalty-free background music from text prompts.

title: Apple Watch Series 10 to Feature Blood Pressure Monitoring
description: Reports indicate the upcoming Apple Watch Series 10 (AAPL) will include a new sensor capable of monitoring the user's blood pressure for the first time.

title: Google Bard Renamed to 'Gemini', Launches Paid Tier
description: Google (GOOGL) has officially rebranded its AI chatbot from Bard to 'Gemini' and launched 'Gemini Advanced', a paid subscription tier powered by its Ultra model.

title: Hong Kong Approves First Batch of Spot Bitcoin ETFs
description: Regulators in Hong Kong have given the green light to the first group of spot Bitcoin (BTCUSD) ETFs, set to begin trading next month.

title: Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) v13 Released to Employees
description: Tesla (TSLA) has begun internally rolling out FSD Beta v13, which CEO Elon Musk claims is a 'quantum leap' in autonomy, based on a new end-to-end AI model.

title: Fed Holds Interest Rates Steady, Signals One More Hike Possible
description: The Federal Reserve concluded its meeting by holding interest rates steady but updated its 'dot plot' to signal the possibility of one more 25-basis-point hike before year-end.

title: Amazon to Lay Off 500 Employees in its Alexa Division
description: Amazon (AMZN) is cutting several hundred jobs from its Alexa division as it refocuses resources on generative AI and large language models.

title: Meta Sued by 40 States Over Youth Mental Health Harms
description: A bipartisan coalition of 40 attorneys general is suing Meta (META), alleging that Instagram and Facebook were designed to be addictive and harmful to children's mental health.

title: Cisco Posts Strong Earnings on AI-Driven Networking Demand
description: Cisco (CSCO) beat Q3 earnings expectations, reporting robust demand for its high-speed networking equipment used in AI data centers. Stock is up 6%.

title: NVIDIA's $5B Acquisition of AI Startup 'SynthAI' Approved
description: NVIDIA's (NVDA) proposed $5 billion acquisition of AI software startup 'SynthAI' has received regulatory approval from all jurisdictions.

title: Ethereum Layer 2 'Starknet' Announces Massive Airdrop
description: Starknet, a prominent Ethereum Layer 2 scaling solution, has announced plans for a large-scale token airdrop to its early users and developers.

title: Apple Lowers iPhone 17 Production Targets, Citing Weak Demand
description: Supply chain sources indicate Apple (AAPL) is lowering its initial production targets for the upcoming iPhone 17, anticipating weaker consumer upgrade cycles.

title: Google and HP Launch New 'Chromebook Plus' Lineup
description: Google (GOOGL) and HP (HPQ) have partnered to launch 'Chromebook Plus', a new, more powerful category of Chromebooks designed for AI-powered applications.

title: Microsoft Wins $9B Pentagon Cloud Computing Contract
description: Microsoft (MSFT) has secured a $9 billion Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability (JWCC) contract from the Pentagon, along with Google, Amazon, and Oracle.

title: US GDP Grows at 3.0% Annualized Rate in Q3, Beating Estimates
description: The US economy grew at a 3.0% annualized rate in the third quarter, according to the advance estimate, stronger than the 2.7% forecast by economists.

title: AMD Announces New 'Ryzen AI' Software Platform for Developers
description: AMD (AMD) launched its 'Ryzen AI' software suite, designed to help developers optimize and deploy AI models on PCs equipped with its AI-capable processors.

title: Tesla Giga Texas Produces its 1 Millionth 4680 Battery Cell
description: Tesla's (TSLA) Giga Texas factory has reportedly hit a milestone, producing its one-millionth 4680 battery cell, though volume production remains a challenge.

title: Intel (INTC) Stock Sinks 8% After Disappointing Q4 Forecast
description: Despite a Q3 earnings beat, Intel (INTC) stock is trading down 8% after the company provided a Q4 revenue and profit forecast well below Wall Street expectations.

title: Netflix Games Library to Add 'Grand Theft Auto: Vice City'
description: Netflix (NFLX) announced it is adding 'Grand Theft Auto: Vice City' to its mobile games library, available for free to all subscribers.

title: Amazon's Twitch Lays Off 35% of Staff Amid Restructuring
description: Amazon's (AMZN) live-streaming platform, Twitch, is laying off over 500 employees, or 35% of its workforce, citing high operational costs.

title: Binance Receives Full Regulatory License in France
description: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance (BNBUSD) has been granted a full license by French financial regulators, allowing it to operate and market its services in the country.

title: Apple and Google Face UK Probe Over 'Duopoly' in Mobile Browsers
description: The UK's CMA has launched an investigation into Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOGL) over their effective duopoly on mobile ecosystems and browser engines.

title: Google Cloud Next: New AI Partnerships and 'Vertex AI' Updates
description: At its Cloud Next conference, Google (GOOGL) announced new AI partnerships with companies like SAP and Workday, and unveiled major updates to its Vertex AI platform.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) is the New 'King of Wall Street', Analyst Says
description: A Wedbush analyst has called NVIDIA (NVDA) the new 'King of Wall Street', raising his price target to $1,200 and calling the AI revolution a '1995 moment'.

title: Housing Starts Fall to 3-Year Low as Mortgage Rates Bite
description: US new housing starts dropped 8% in October to their lowest level in three years, as 8% mortgage rates bring the construction market to a halt.

title: OpenAI Considering Spinning Off AI Chip Division, MSFT to Invest
description: A report suggests OpenAI is exploring spinning off its internal AI chip development division into a new company, with Microsoft (MSFT) as a lead investor.
